subject: p19800337
History: Followup of the patient with pneumonia.
Findings: PA and lateral upright chest radiographs were reviewed in comparison to. The right basal opacity appears to be still present, although improved since the prior study and might reflect interval decrease in size of infectious process. Repeated evaluation in four weeks is recommended. The finding is still persistent, assessment with chest CT would be required to exclude the possibility of post-obstructive pneumonia.
